text: Frank-Walter Steinmeier (born 5 January 1956) is a German politician. He was Foreign Secretary, Vice Chancellor of Germany and is currently the twelfth President of the Federal Republic of Germany. Steinmeier was born in Detmold in 1956. After his abitur (secondary school exam) and his military service, he studied law in Gießen. In 1982, he passed his first exam. His second exam was completed and passed in 1986. Between 1986 and 1991, he worked as assistant to the Doctor of Public Law and Political Science at the Gießen University.http://www.hpi.uni- potsdam.de/fileadmin/hpi/veranstaltungen/china/slides/conference_binder.pdf "1986 - 1991 Academic assistant, Chair of Public Law and Political Science, Department of Law, Giessen University" He obtained his Doctorate of Law in 1991. After 1991, he worked in the State Chancellory of Lower Saxony for the Minister-President, Gerhard Schröder. From 1998, he was Undersecretary of State in Gerhard Schröder's Chancellor Office after Schröder became Chancellor of Germany. In 1999 he became Secretary of State. In 2005, he became the new Foreign Minister of Germany in the coalition cabinet of Angela Merkel. He became Vice Chancellor of Germany in 2007. In 2008 he was elected to be the chancellor candidate of the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD) for the election in 2009. The SPD got their worst result ever in a German federal election (23.0%), and Steinmeier became leader of the SPD parliamentary group in the Bundestag. From 2013 to 2017 he was again Foreign Minister. Since 19 March 2017 he has been President of Germany, succeeding Joachim Gauck. He was re-elected in 2022 in a landslide victory. == References == Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:Foreign ministers of Germany Category:Politicians from North Rhine-Westphalia Category:Politicians of the Social Democratic Party of Germany Category:Presidents of Germany Category:Vice Chancellors of Germany Category:Heads of the German Chancellery Category:Leaders of the Opposition (Germany) Category:21st-century presidents of Germany
title: Frank-Walter Steinmeier
